A bug-fix update, CLion 2021.2.1, is available for download!

The highlights include:

  • Project model
    • The Mark directory as excluded action is now back in the context menu.
    • Compiler information is now collected correctly when duplicating flags are used, and also for the IAR STM8 compiler.
    • We've fixed CMake Presets parsing when the environment variable has an env macro.
  • In the debugger, several issues with visualization have been fixed for the LLDB-based debugger on Windows (for the MSVC toolchain).
  • Template parameters are no longer folded by default. If you want default folding back, enable Preferences/Settings | Editor | General | Code Folding | Fold by default | C | Template parameters.
  • Formatter
    • We've fixed an editor freeze caused by ClangFormat.
    • The broken auto formatting of switch statements with return has been fixed.
    • New options were added: Preferences/Settings | Editor | Code Style | C/C++ | Spaces | Before/After 'for' colon/semicolon.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2021.1.3, is available for download!

The highlights include:

  • Fixed red CUDA code with Visual Studio C++ toolchain.
  • Fixed the code completion in CUDA code that stopped working after including a normal C++ header file (*.h) to the CUDA files.
  • Fixed the incorrect error Use of undeclared identificator __cudaPushCallConfiguration.
  • CLion no longer shows update notifications from disabled plugins.
  • Fixed an unexpected closure of the Compare with branch dialog.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2020.3.4, is available for download!

  • In this update we've fixed an issue with Compilation Database projects that caused the Build tool window not to be displayed when a project was reloaded using the editor widget.
  • In addition, we've ported the trusted project functionality released earlier as part of CLion 2021.1.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2020.2.5, is available for download!

Here are the most notable improvements:

  • For macOS Big Sur users:
    • Fixed an issue where opening a project in a new window results in opening the project in another tab.
    • Fixed a problem causing CLion to crash after exiting sleep mode.
  • UI:
    • Fixed Find and Replace actions forgetting the size of the text area if it was changed by the user.
  • VCS:
    • The pull dialog now correctly suggests pulling from the latest entered branch instead of the tracked branch.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2020.1.3, is available for download!

Here are the key highlights:

  • An issue with selecting and running multiple CMake Google tests is fixed (CPP-20039).
  • This update introduces the Show Remote Hosts Info diagnostic action,
    which dumps some remote settings and the list of failed remote connections along with their settings.
  • It also brings fixes in the IntelliJ Platform and JetBrains Runtime.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2019.3.6, is available for download!

Here are the key highlights:

  • C++ specific fixes:
    • A fix in Clangd which led to a crash on catch.hpp file.
    • Concepts support, introduced in v2019.3, now also works with the Microsoft Visual C++ toolchain.
  • From the IntelliJ Platform:
    • We've fixed the regression that prevented the IDE from starting if it was installed in a path with non-ASCII characters.
    • The IDE now shows the confirmation dialog when deleting a directory that is under SVN.
    • A bug is fixed with the licence server address cleared when it's unreachable.
  • The issue with displaying the context menu or main menu popups in Full Screen mode under XFCE has been fixed (JBR-2143)

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2019.2.5, is available for download!

This minor release brings some fixes from the IntelliJ Platform, including several notable changes for macOS Catalina:

  • Fixed opening projects on macOS Catalina (JBR-1721).
  • Fixed font rendering in text fields on macOS Catalina (JBR-1863).

For more details, please see the blog post.

A new CLion 2019.1.4 bug-fix update is here!

Here are the key highlights:

  • If you open a project from the invalid compile_commands.json file and then fix it manually,
    CLion will now suggest to auto-reload the project for you
  • Changes in the Environment variables field of the Run/Debug Configurations are now saved correctly by the IDE
  • The font settings on Linux are now saved correctly by the IDE
  • The Find in Path dialog now closes when opening a project in the same window

For more details, please see the blog post.

CLion 2018.3.4 is here with several important fixes:

  • Fixed issue which affects Windows users who develop remotely and use a shared remote server (CPP-15017).
  • Accessibility improvements: IDEA-204449, IDEA-203712.

For more details, please see the release notes.

DataGrip 2021.2.2 is Out!

Improvements

  • DBE-2216: Wildcards are now considered as column usages.
  • DBE-13773: Ctrl/Cmd+Click from the navigation bar correctly navigates to the desired element.
  • DBE-8885: [SQL Server] Line numbers are included in error messages.
  • DBE-13732: [ClickHouse] There is now a special node for distributed tables in the database explorer.

Fixes

  • DBE-12656: Enable DBMS_OUTPUT works immediately after being turned on.
  • DBE-13862: The Update and Delete fields are no longer hidden in the Modify Table dialog.
  • DBE-13278: The inspection that reports unsafe queries has become smarter.
  • DBE-13945:Ctrl/Cmd+N works as before in the data editor.
  • DBE-13907: [PostgreSQL] It's possible to modify sequences in version 10 and lower.
  • DBE-13566: [Snowflake] We've fixed a problem preventing the import of large CSV files.

DataGrip 2021.1.3

Fixes

  • DBE-13313: Fixed the "handshake error" problem when connecting to the database.
  • DBE-13287: Code completion now works in the Modify Table even if the case doesn't match.
  • DBE-13292: [SQL Server] Extended properties are not included in the generated DDL.
  • DBE-13350: [Oracle] Introspection is compatible with version 9i.

DataGrip 2020.3.2 is Out!

Important fixes

  • DBE-12398: The problem with freezes on Test Connection is fixed.
  • DBE-12367: Athena introspection works again.
  • DBE-12168: The Submit changes immediately option is back.
  • DBE-10828: The JDBC URL is not pasted in the data source name by default.

DataGrip 2020.2.3

Important fixes:

  • DBE-11340: The username and password fields no longer disappear.
  • DBE-11156: When updating the source code, if a new version contains errors and fails to be submitted, you'll now see a prompt to restore the previous version.
  • DBE-11440: [SQL Server] Submit changes to database works again for procedures.

DataGrip 2020.1.5

Most important

  • The issue with SQL Server Authentication on Windows is fixed.

Other fixes

  • DBE-9876: Forced execution in read-only mode now runs the correct query.
  • DBE-10727: Schemas comparator respects column order.
  • DBE-10715: [PostgreSQL]: DataGrip no longer throws a time zone error for versions of PostgreSQL before 10.
  • DBE-10724: [Snowflake]: The Modify Table dialog generates valid code.

New features

  • A new quick-fix is available: Refresh schema.
  • The migration buttons now tell clearer what they actually do.
  • If you create a DDL data source, the folder with the sources will automatically be attached to the project.
  • If you try to change the DDL of the target table during the data import process, DataGrip will warn you.
  • If an Oracle database wants you to change an expired password, you can do so from the UI.

DataGrip 2019.3.5 is Out!

Important bug fixes:

  • IDEA-238386, IDEA-236342, IDEA-219779: Fixed problems with licensing.
  • DBE-10396: Errors no longer occur while creating object files in SQL Generator.
  • DBE-10371: Opening an SQL file from Explorer no longer creates a new project.

DataGrip 2019.2.6 is Out!

  • Result tabs switch with the consoles again.
  • No more freezes on MacOS Catalina when exporting data. DBE-9334
  • Fixed the bugs with the external tables in Redshift not showing. DBE-9181
  • Various bugs with paging are fixed. DBE-9217
  • Column names are no longer collapsed when the data editor is transposed. DBE-8904
  • The "column specified more than once" error does not appear for data import anymore. DBE-9283
  • The table and column comments are not truncated anymore. DBE-8000
  • There are no longer false warnings about the number of values when selecting the identity column. DBE-8924

DataGrip 2019.1.4 is Out!

Bug fixes

  • We hope that, finally, all the performance problems on startup are fixed! JBR-1393
  • The Filter History is preserved in the data editor after a restart DBE-8318
  • Boolean values can be edited when creating a new row DBE-7701
  • [Oracle] DataGrip doesn't hang when working with big packages DBE-8499
  • [Apache Ignite] Data editor now works DBE-8453

DataGrip 2018.3.4 is Out! Some bug-fixes are inside.

SQL formatter: we're still improving it!

  • DBE-4805: We keep the case of quoted identifiers in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-6937: Better arrays formatting in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-7362: Formatter works in SQL-injections.
  • DBE-7376: Better WITH formatting.
  • DBE-7605: Support for INTO TEMP TABLE in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-7806: Better formatting for variables in SQL Server.
  • DBE-7881: Support for ON CONFLICT clause in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-7890: No more line break after PERFORM in PostgreSQL.

Other

  • During data import errors are written into a file by default.
  • DBE-7838: Fixed bug with missed reference when creating a foreign key.
  • DBE-7840: Autoscroll from the editor works correctly.
  • DBE-7896: No more raw HTML in notifications.

DataGrip 2018.2.5 is Out

Fix:

– JRE-998 – stderr was cleaned from redundant output

DataGrip 2018.1.6 is Out

Fix:

– JRE-998 – Freezing input after the MacOS key-selector on Mojave

DataGrip 2017.3.7 is Out.

Important bug fixes:

— DBE-5904: The names of folders with console files don’t contain GUIDs anymore.
— Fixed additional issues with scrolling diagrams.
— Built-in SSH executable now supports strong cryptographic algorithms.

DataGrip 2017.2.3 is Out

— IDE doesn't freeze while building database diagram

DataGrip 2017.1.5 is Out

Most important fixes:

– DBE-2771 – Important fix with "column reference is ambiguous" for PostgreSQL EDB users.
– DBE-4753 – "Invalidate Caches/Restart" is enabled in the Find action menu.
– DBE-4733 – Empty rows are removed from the console output tab.
DataGrip 2016.3.4 is here

DataGrip 2016.2.6 is released.

  • Fixed problem with sensitive scrolling on macOS Sierra
In DataGrip 2016.1.2 we've fixed the problem with information about the perpetual fallback license.
In DataGrip 1.0.5 we've fixed the problem with information about the perpetual fallback license.

GoLand 2021.2.2 is out!

The main highlights:

  • WEB-52111, WEB-52307, WEB-51975 - Several Vue-related bugs were fixed.

  • IDEA-275145 - The call hierarchy bug was fixed.

Read the release notes to get the full overview of the update!

GoLand 2021.1.3 is here!

The main highlights:

  • GO-11184 — As you might know, you get a perpetual fallback license when you buy a one-year license for any of JetBrains products (except our Team Tools). This page has more details about that.
  • Now version information is more easily discoverable via Help | About (on Windows and Linux) or GoLand | About (on macOS).The previous update accidentally removed version information from that window, but now it’s back.
  • GO-10986 — You can run go check via the menu when you click the Run gutter icon in the editor as usual.

GoLand 2020.3.5 is out!

It's time for an upgrade! GoLand 2020.3.5 is out with a fix for Go 1.17 SDK versions. Want to know how you can contribute to the Go with GoLand? Start here.

Read the release notes to get the full overview of the update!

GoLand 2020.2.4 is out!

The main highlights:

  • — JBR-2866 — The Markdown editor no longer steals focus from other windows in the IDE.
  • — JBR-2879 — The problem causing GoLand to open your project in a new tab instead of a new window on macOS BigSur has been fixed.

Read the release notes to learn more.

GoLand 2020.1.4 is out!

  • <IDEA-237974, IDEA-238301 – Fixed a UI freeze.
  • IDEA-243130 – Calling the --help argument of the сommand-line launcher no longer opens the dialog in the IDE and doesn’t close the IDE itself.
  • DBE-10457 – A new Refresh schema quick-fix lets you make sure that your query in the database is properly highlighted.
  • DBE-2516 – GoLand now allows you to update cells and add/remove columns and rows in the Table editor for updatable views.

Read the blog post to learn more.

GoLand 2019.3.4 is out!

GoLand 2019.3.4 is released with fixes for two annoying problems. Running and debugging test functions with Testify now works as expected, and using long test names on Windows no longer causes tests to fail unexpectedly. See the release notes to learn more.

GoLand 2019.2.5 bug-fix update is out!

  • This bug-fix update provides a fix for the problem causing systems with particular display scaling settings to crash.

GoLand 2019.1.4 is released!

This update brings a pinch of bug fixes for refactorings and for the wrong behaviour of code inspection. See the release notes to learn more.

GoLand 2018.3.6 is out!

This update consists a pinch of bug-fixes. See release notes to learn more.

IntelliJ IDEA 2021.2.2 Release Candidate is available with minor fixes and the following significant fix and update:

  • Fixed the Hierarchy tool window to show the usages of an interface method that has at least one implementation. [IDEA-275145]
  • JBR 11 was updated to 11.0.11-b1460.1.

You can find a full list of all the resolved issues in the release notes.

IntelliJ IDEA 2021.2.1 is available with the following fixes:

  • Fixed the behavior of the Ctrl+Shift+Left/Right shortcuts: they now correctly extend the text selection before or after the caret. [IDEA-267294]
  • Fixed the issues causing the file type setting to be reset when the IDE restarted. [IDEA-274889]
  • Fixed Maven multi-module recognition in WSL 2. [IDEA-265900]
  • Fixed the Run/Debug Configuration issue: when you click the Run button, the IDE runs the configuration selected in the combo box. [IDEA-244454]
  • Fixed several shortcut issues in the IntelliJ IDEA terminal. [IDEA-271542], [IDEA-271777], [IDEA-274574]
  • Fixed the problem causing the IDE to freeze when opening a project from WSL 2. [IDEA-273398]

For the full list of issues we've resolved, read our blog post.

IntelliJ IDEA 2021.1.3 is available with the following bug fixes and improvements:

  • JBR 11 was updated to 11.0.11-b1341.60.
  • Fixed the error that appears when you click Download sources for Maven projects. [IDEA-247792]
  • Fixed the problems behind several UI freezes. [JBR-2755]
  • Ctrl+Shift+Arrow keys works for text selection as it should. [IDEA-267294]
  • The IDE loads resource files in a Gradle project with module-info.java. [IDEA-197469]

For an extended list of the issues we've addressed, read our blog post.

IntelliJ IDEA 2020.3.4 is available with the following bug fixes:

  • The IDE now loads the correct version of the Maven dependency. [IDEA-255594]
  • Returned the speed of autocompletion to normal. [IDEA-264579]
  • Fixed the warning about an illegal reflective access operation. [IDEA-248785]
  • Fixed the deadlock upon generating Java code from an XML schema using JAXB. [IDEA-257312]
  • Fixed the Lombok error that would occur when a log was used in a static block.

For more addressed issues, refer to our blog post or the release notes.

IntelliJ IDEA 2020.2.4 is available with the following fixes.

For IntelliJ IDEA:

  • Fixed the formatting of Gherkin files [IDEA-251322].
  • Fixed module dependency in Gradle projects [IDEA-232283].
  • Fixed Search For Class in Maven projects [IDEA-215618].

For JBR:

  • JBR 11 has been updated to 11.0.9+11-b944.49.
  • Fixed JCEF issues involving the Markdown editor stealing focus [JBR-2866], [JBR-2872].
  • Fixed the way a new project opens on macOS BigSur [JBR-2879].
  • Fixed problem causing IntelliJ IDEA to crash after exiting sleep mode on macOS BigSur [JBR-2790].

For more information, read our blog post.

Fixes and improvements

IntelliJ IDEA 2020.1.4 is now available.

  • Fixed excessive Hot Swap background processes: IDEA-240241.
  • Fixed exceptions thrown with language packs enabled: IDEA-242047.
Read the blog post for more details.

Fixes and improvements

IntelliJ IDEA 2019.3.5 is here! It brings a variety of updates and bug fixes.

  • We've fixed the regression that caused v2019.3.4 not to start when installed in a path with non-ASCII characters: IDEA-235754.
  • The IDE now shows the confirmation dialog when deleting a directory which is under SVN: IDEA-228828.
  • The Gradle daemon no longer starts with debugging enabled when debugging tests and delegating to Gradle: IDEA-235648.
  • The JBR has been updated to v11.0.6+8-b520.66.
For more details please refer to the blog post.

Fixes and Improvements

IntelliJ IDEA 2019.2.4 is available! Here's the list of improvements:

  • Improved "safe write" mode and kept the original file permissions intact IDEA-152607.
  • Fixed JavaFX Scene Builder integration IDEA-209562.
  • Fixed debugging issues with Gradle parallel execution enabled IDEA-207748.
  • Resolved the jbr/bin/java Access Denied error in IDE updates IDEA-215497.
  • Added an option to choose how a compiler will treat a dedicated processor path IDEA-220430.
    Read more on the blog.

JBR 11 was updated to 11.0.4+10-b304.77. Notable changes:

  • Fixed opening projects on macOS Catalina JBR-1721.
  • Fixed font rendering in text fields on macOS Catalina JBR-1863.

Bug Fixes and Improvements

IntelliJ IDEA 2019.1.4 is here with the several notable bugs fixes and
performance improvements:

  • The IDE doesn't lose the focus after escaping the "Find in Path..." dialog:
    IDEA-215107.
  • The extract method shortcut doesn't enter the µ symbol in the method name field anymore:
    IDEA-187355.
  • The issue that prevented the typing in the detached editor on macOS is fixed:
    IDEA-189984.
  • The alphabetical sorting in File Structure popup now persists after closing:
    IDEA-125108.
  • Fixed regression: it's now possible to paste the value containing equals sign
    in the environment variables: IDEA-210897.
  • Fixed performance issues: IDEA-216453, IDEA-211672, IDEA-216728.
  • JBR 8 was updated to v1.8.0_212-release-1586-b4.
  • JBR 11 was updated to v11.0.2+9-b159.64.

For more details, please refer to the blog post.

Bug fixes and improvements

IntelliJ IDEA 2018.3.6 is released!

  • The Parameter Info tooltip doesn’t hide the code being edited anymore:
    IDEA-185682.
  • The PivotalTracker integration works correctly again: IDEA-205965.

Idea Edu 2021.2 is now available.

  • JetBrains Academy:
    • EDU-4486 (Performance Problem): Improve speed of opening JetBrains Academy tasks
    • EDU-4029 (Task): Support "edu" steps as JetBrains Academy code challenges
    • EDU-4332 (Bug): "Solve in IDE" Button does not open the Task in the IDE
    • EDU-4487 (Bug): Checker works incorrectly for "edu" JBA steps if user is logged out
  • Marketplace:
    • EDU-4477 (Bug): Do not post theory to Stepik at Marketplace courses theory tasks opening
  • Course Selection View:
    • EDU-4125 (Usability Problem): Add placeholder for courses search field in Browse Courses dialog
    • EDU-4482 (Bug): Open button is called "Start" instead of "Open"
    • EDU-3653 (Bug): Center text in new welcome screen panel
    • EDU-4199 (Bug): Incorrect "Nothing completed yet" text for courses in courses creation mode
  • Codeforces:
    • EDU-4425 (Feature): Add end date, participants number and info message to contest description panel in Courses dialog

PhpStorm 2021.2.2 Preview

The preview build for PhpStorm 2021.2.2 is available with a bunch of bugfixes and stability improvements.

It also brings support for more PHP 8.1 features. Give it a try and send us your feedback.

Notable changes:

  • Adding the Angular 12 inline scss support (WEB-51018)
  • Regular expression support in sqlite (DBE-10115)
  • Nuxt 2.0: update support for auto imported components (WEB-50409)
  • Support readonly properties (parser support) (WI-61928)
  • Support intersection types (WI-61861)
  • Support explicit octal integer literal notation (parser + language level) (WI-61926)
  • Support final class constants (parser + language level) (WI-61927)

The full list of changes in this build is available in the release notes.

PhpStorm 2021.2.1 is available

Notable updates in this update:

  • Fixed: Re-arrange did not reorder the method with modifiers and name both [WI-30563]
  • Fixed: CSS class completion doesn't work great with Tailwind 2.1 in "jit" mode. [WEB-50318]
  • Vue 3: Support new <script setup> without ref sugar [WEB-49000]
  • Usage of PSR-2 comment suggestion on no-break switch cases [WI-32123]
  • Fixed: Freeze on opening project from WSL2 [IDEA-]273398
  • Fixed: Showing failed PHPUnit test as passing with incorrect log output (on WSL) [WI-46570]
  • Fixed: Splash is not shown in 2021.2 [IDEA-]270204
  • Support inference based on IteratorAggregate<User> [WI-61438]
  • Fixed: Add property quick fix adds property without dollar sign [WI-34398]
  • Enable breadcrumbs by default [WI-59237]
  • Support phpstan-* annotation for templates (@phpstan-template/@phpstan-param/@phpstan-return, ...) [WI-57959]

The full list of changes in this build is available in the release notes.

PyCharm 2021.2.2 Release Candidate is out!

PyCharm 2021.2.2 Release Candidate is available with the following fixes:

  • Fixed the generation of requirements.txt file with the list of imported packages. [PY-41953]
  • Fixed the issue with the WSL Python interpreter. [PY-48100]
  • Fixed the ability to use external diff tools. [IDEA-271200]
  • Fixed the stop button so it now terminates running processes on the first attempt. [IDEA-276772]
  • Fixed the code analysis issue causing warnings, suggestions, and errors not to disappear when resolved. [IDEA-275168]
  • Fixed the error that would occur when trying to establish an SSH connection. [IDEA-277053]
  • Fixed the Rename refactoring shortcut. [IDEA-274923]

Read the release notes to check out all the fixes.

Found a bug? Please report it using our bug tracker.

PyCharm 2021.2.1 is out!

Here are the fixes we worked on:

  • Docker Compose: when the Docker Compose V2 experimental feature is enabled, it is now possible to create a Python interpreter. [PY-49305]
  • Flask: the debugger now works correctly in Flask projects. [PY-49984]
  • Parser: the false positive "Statement expected. found Py:DEDENT" no longer appears. [PY-49970]
  • HTML preview: you can switch between reload on save and reload on changes mode for the built-in server and HTML preview. [WEB-51695]
  • Test runner autodetection: navigation to pytest fixture declarations works when using the autodetected pytest test runner. [PY-49770]
  • Python console: the "Execute current statement" in One-Line Console action works in Float mode. [PY-49527]
  • Python 3.10 support: the type checker for the new union types' syntax works correctly with Django Rest Framework permission classes. [PY-49697]
  • Debugger: debugging Python 3.9 for Windows 10 x64 is available. [PY-45084]
  • Debug tool window: the Update Running Application button is available. [IDEA-274540]

Read the blogpost and the release notes to check out all the changes.

Found a bug? Please report it using our bug tracker.

PyCharm 2021.1.3 is out!

Here are the fixes we worked on:

  • Fixed the problems behind several UI freezes. [JBR-2755]
  • Fixed the infinite indexing issue. [IDEA-266989]
  • User interface: Ctrl+Shift+Arrow shortcut selects text in a dialog window rather than stretching the window. [IDEA-267294]
  • It is now possible to work with KWallet without errors. [IDEA-261634]
  • Quick documentation: .jpeg and .svg images are rendered correctly. [IDEA-256001]
  • Plugins: disabled plugins that have been updated to the latest version don't cause a false notification saying a plugin update is required. [IDEA-267878]
  • VCS: Fixed an unexpected closure of the "Compare branch" dialog. [IDEA-251381]
  • Projector: PyCharm doesn't crash on restart when Projector is used. [IDEA-269591]
  • Python Console: "Run Cell and Select Below" shortcut (Ctrl+Enter) in SciView now moves the caret to the next cell after execution. [PY-48157]
  • Django: Code Completion for Django Models now works correctly. [PY-48252]
  • Debugger: when the "Attach to Node.js/Chrome" Run/Debug configuration is used, the debugger reconnects automatically upon node restart. [WEB-50455]
  • Databases: code completion for table synonyms works correctly for databases in MS SQL. [DBE-4531]

Read the blogpost and the release notes to check out all the changes.

Found a bug? Please report it using our bug tracker.

    • Fixed "C/C++ courses are not supported" error for Stepik and Codeforces C++ courses.
    • Fixes for "Restart/Remove Course" actions.
    • Fixed exception caused by having default non-English locale.

Check out this blog post for more information.

Please welcome Rider 2021.2.1!

Here is a list of the top bug fixes: 

  • We’ve fixed two issues that prevented debugging Blazor WebAssembly applications (RIDER-65999 and RIDER-66599).
  • T4 template execution works again on macOS (RIDER-66097).
  • No more errors on an Average() call being ambiguous between Nullable<float> and Nullable<double> (RSRP-484898) and no more 'The type xxx is defined in an assembly that is not referenced...' error for Unity/Mono projects (RSRP-485467).
  • You can debug a DLL which is loaded from a stream in an AssemblyLoadContext (RIDER-66244).
  • The "Run all tests" and "Run selected tests" icons in the Unit Tests Explorer are no longer disabled when you open a test project (RIDER-66137).
  • Ctrl+Shift+Arrow keys ("Stretch to Right"/"Stretch to Left" actions) no longer resize the dialog instead of text selection (IDEA-267294).


You can see all of the issues we fixed in the Rider 2021.2.1 build here.
Rider 2021.1.5 is here with a fix for major performance degradation and updates for how F# projects are managed. Check out this blog post for the details.
We've introduced the concept of trusted projects to mitigate the risks associated with opening projects from unknown and untrusted sources. This blog post has the details.
Rider 2020.2.5 is a bugfix release to introduce support for macOS Big Sur.

Rider 2020.1.4 bugfix is available!

  • No more indefinite "waiting for intention actions..." message after calling the Alt+Enter menu.
  • Rider can successfully connect to MS SQL Server.
  • Better support for one more C# 8 language feature: the ability to mark property accessors separately with the Obsolete and Deprecated attributes.

Rider 2019.3.4 bugfix update is here!

  • We’ve eliminated the deadlock that affected three tasks, “Analyzing solution”, “Loading solution / Starting features...”, and “Loading analysis results”, while a solution was being loaded.
  • We’ve fixed the performance problem that was forcing the "Processing source files" task to take almost an hour to complete.
Rider 2019.2.4 brings back feature-rich support for F# script files (.fsx) on macOS and Linux, which was accidentally broken in the 2019.2 release.

Rider 2019.1.3 bugfix update is here!

  • Fixes to make the Entity Framework integration work again.
  • A fix to correctly resolve file paths in ASP.NET markup files.
  • Fixed support for .ashx files.
  • To-do items won’t disappear after adding a new custom To-do.

Check out the blog post for more info.

Rider 2018.3.5 is here!

It fixes the IDE crash after installing the “Azure DevOps” plugin (RIDER-26765), formerly called “Visual Studio Team Services”.

Rider 2018.2.3 release notes:

  • Rider correctly calculates C# language version based on the latest value in a csproj file (RSRP-471483).
  • Azure DevOps URLs in NuGet Credential Provider is supported (RIDER-19664).
  • We’ve fixed the Unhandled Exception while running Unity in batchmode (RIDER-19688).

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2021.2 update is here!

Rider for Unreal Engine 2021.2 brings all of the goodies delivered recently in Rider and ReSharper C++ 2021.2 releases:

  • Inlay hints for hidden type conversions
  • New immutability inspections
  • New inspections to help you modernize your code
  • A new Inline Function refactoring
  • Improved performance and memory usage of a cold startup for Unreal Engine projects
  • Enhancements in VCS support, UI, and UX

Thank you for using Rider for Unreal Engine! We hope you enjoy the experience and see your productivity growing. To help us sort out and prioritize our final plans before the release, please fill out the survey and share your thoughts with us.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2021.1.3 update is here!

This update brings more fixes for Unreal Engine 5 projects and unveils our debugger overhaul, which significantly improves the way variables are rendered in the debugger.

  • Improved Natvis support
    • Support for Inheritable attribute, format specifiers, CustomListItems.
    • Better built-in renderers.
  • A fix for the incorrect rendering of the tuple collection (especially critical for the TTuple, TVariant, and TArray types with non-standard allocators).
  • Fixes for Unreal Engine 5.

Read on for more details in our blog.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2020.3.4 update is here!

This build comes with a hotfix for the problem causing the debugger to crash on applications built with FASTBuild. The issue has been eliminated, and you can now successfully debug such apps in Rider.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2020.2.2 update is here!

Here are the highlights:

  • In UnrealLink/RiderLink plugin:
    • The plugin is now hosted on JetBrains Marketplace,
      so we can now update it independently from the Rider for Unreal Engine release cycle.
    • Fixed build issues for UE 4.23 and earlier.
    • Fixed UI freezes when there are too many messages in the Unreal log panel.
  • In general C++ support:
    • Fixed an issue with the Switch Header/Source action
      sometimes not working properly when a preview panel is open.
    • Fixed an issue with the Go to file member action
      which behaves incorrectly in UE sources when Treat Unreal Engine symbols as non-project is on.
  • In Blueprints integration:
    • We have some reports about high memory use and performance issues caused by the Blueprints integration.
      While we are investigating the root cause of this, you can temporarily disable Blueprints support
      in File | Settings | Languages & Frameworks | C++ | Unreal Engine settings.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2020.1.3 update is here!

Here are some of the main highlights:

  • Experimental support for the Unreal Engine project model is introduced.
    • Enable it with File | Settings | Languages & Frameworks | C++ | Unreal Engine | [Experimental] Use Unreal Engine project model.
    • When opening a solution in this mode, Rider will take the modules-structured information about defines, include paths,
      and (starting from UE 4.25) PCH force includes from UBT instead of the .vcxproj files.
    • This guarantees correct coding assistance (like code completion or navigation) for configurations other than the default (Development Editor | Win64).
  • Fixes for the RiderLink/UnrealLink plugins:
    • RiderLink is now installed into the Engine itself instead of a game project. During the installation process,
      the plugin will be built and put into the correct folder, and a progress bar now appears when installing the plugin.
    • An option was added to compile the game before starting PIE from Rider.
    • The plugin no longer breaks the compilation of Unreal Engine projects in Rider.
  • Debugger enhancements and fixes:
    • Debug session no longer freezes on stop. (This happened when the target process spawned another child process that was later detached.)
    • A bug when child members weren't shown for some values is now fixed.
    • Threads are now named automatically based on their entry-point function.
    • Debugger got significant performance improvements, many freezes and crashes were fixed.
    • Fixes for stepping issues in multithreaded code, fixes for floating point type variables and arguments, and much more.
  • Fixes for the "Navigate to the derived symbols" action and auto-import invoked on enum or typedef.
  • Fixes for the incorrect window autoscroll when typing and editor crash in some cases.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

WebStorm 2021.2.2 Release Candidate is now available!

What's fixed:

  • Fixed the bug with the Stop button not terminating running processes on the first attempt (IDEA-276772).
  • Enable external diff tool should now work as expected (IDEA-271200).
  • Added support for inline SCSS in Angular 12 (WEB-51018).
  • Fixed a number of issues with Tailwind CSS (WEB-51764, WEB-52401, WEB-49736, WEB-52329, WEB-52506, and WEB-52535).
  • Code completion will work for style sheet properties and values in React Native apps (WEB-43144).

For more details, please see the release notes.

WebStorm 2021.2.1 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • Added support for script setup and fixed some other issues with Vue support (WEB-49000, WEB-47248, WEB-48792, WEB-51614, and WEB-42754).
  • Reworked support for Tailwind CSS to make it possible to use JIT mode (WEB-50318).
  • Added the ability to choose if you want to insert braces on code completion (WEB-31404).
  • Solved the problem causing the IDE to freeze when opening a project from WSL 2 (IDEA-273398).
  • Added support for shorthand properties in Angular templates (WEB-51572).
  • Ctrl+arrow keys used in the built-in terminal should now work as expected (IDEA-271542).

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2021.1.3 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • Fixed the issue with the debugger not reconnecting automatically (WEB-50455).
  • Fixed the regression bug causing the Stretch to Right / Stretch to Left actions not to work as expected (IDEA-267294).
  • Fixed the bug causing the Compare with branch dialog to close unexpectedly (IDEA-251381).
  • Solved the problem with images not being rendered in the Documentation popup (IDEA-256001).

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2020.3.3 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • Fixed a number of regression bugs (WEB-48038, WEB-49135, WEB-49137, and WEB-49156).
  • Solved the problem with high CPU usage (WEB-48983).
  • Fixed the bug with Git diff changes shown incorrectly (IDEA-257651).
  • The Close All but Pinned action now works as expected (IDEA-256044).
  • Introduced the concept of trusted projects.

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2020.2.4 is now available!
